Steam (ST): Doctor Nanjo's shirt had been sprayed by a violent spurt of blood, so it was easy to imagine the devotion with which he had tried to save Kanon's life...up until the last second.

PC Japanese (JP): 「そんな言い方ってねぇぜッ？！　嘉音くんは犯人の姿を見つけて、勇敢に立ち向かったんだ！！　熊沢さんも一緒だったら、犯人は躊躇して逃げることを選んだかもしれない！！」

Russian (RU): "Что за чушь?! Канон‐кун заметил преступника и отважно выступил против него! Быть может, пойди с ним Кумасава‐сан, преступник мог бы заколебаться и предпочесть сбежать!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Como você pode dizer isso?! O Kanon‐kun avistou o assassino e bravamente foi contra ele!! Se a Kumasawa‐san tivesse ido com ele, o assassino poderia ter hesitado e escolhido fugir!!"
Vietnamese (VI): "How can you say it like that?! Kanon‐kun spotted the killer and bravely stood up to them!! If only Kumasawa‐san had gone with him, the killer might have hesitated and chosen to run away!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你說什麼？！嘉音君找到了犯人，並勇敢地和犯人對抗！！如果熊澤婆婆也在一起的話，犯人說不定就會有所顧忌而選擇逃跑了！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你说什么？！嘉音君找到了犯人，并勇敢地和犯人对抗！！如果熊泽婆婆也在一起的话，犯人说不定就会有所顾忌而选择逃跑了！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "How can you say it like that?! Kanon-kun spotted the culprit and bravely stood up to them!! If only Kumasawa-san had gone with him, the culprit might've hesitated and chosen to run away!!"
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Come puoi dire una cosa simile?! Kanon-kun ha visto il colpevole e coraggiosamente gli si è opposto!! Se solo Kumasawa-san fosse andata con lui, il colpevole avrebbe potuto esitare e scegliere di scappar via!!"
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "Come puoi dire una cosa simile?! Kanon-kun aveva trovato il colpevole, e si è opposto a lui con coraggio!! Se anche Kumasawa-san fosse andata con lui, il colpevole avrebbe potuto esitare e decidere di scappar via!!"
Turkish (TR): "Bunu nasıl söylersin?! Kanon-kun katili fark etti ve cesurca karşılarına dikildi!! Eğer Kumasawa-san onunla gitmiş olsaydı, katil tereddüt edip kaçmayı seçebilirdi!!"

Steam (ST): A desolate feeling filled the room... It felt as though things would just get more complicated if anyone spoke.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "...At any rate, this is no time to quarrel. ...Now that we are certain the culprit can enter and leave the mansion at will and strike out of nowhere, we must give our undivided attention to surviving until tomorrow."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Anyway, now is not the time for discord. ......Now that we are certain that the killer can enter and leave the mansion at will and strike out of nowhere, we must give our undivided attention to surviving until tomorrow."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Anyway, now is not the time for discord. ......Now that we are certain that the culprit can enter and leave the mansion at will and strike out of nowhere, we must give our undivided attention to surviving until tomorrow."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……とにかく、今は仲違いをしている時ではありません。……犯人が神出鬼没に屋敷内を出入りしていることが間違いなくなった今、私たちは明日まで身を守ることだけに専念しなくてはなりません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……とにかく、今は仲違いをしている時ではありません。……犯人が神出鬼没に屋敷内を出入りしていることが間違いなくなった今、私たちは明日まで身を守ることだけに専念しなくてはなりません」
Russian (RU): "......В любом случае, сейчас не время для раздоров. .....Теперь, когда мы уверены в том, что преступник может свободно входить и выходить из дома, мы должны сосредоточить своё внимание на выживании до завтрашнего дня."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......De qualquer forma, agora não é o momento de discórdia. ......Agora que temos certeza de que o assassino pode entrar e sair da mansão à vontade e atacar do nada, devemos fazer de tudo para sobreviver até amanhã."
Vietnamese (VI): "......Anyway, now is not the time for discord. ......Now that we are certain that the killer can enter and leave the mansion at will and strike out of nowhere, we must give our undivided attention to surviving until tomorrow."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……不管怎樣，現在不是鬧矛盾的時候。……如今在已經確定“犯人能神出鬼沒地出入大屋內的房間”的情況下，我們必須集中精力，保護自己活到明天。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……不管怎样，现在不是闹矛盾的时候。……如今在已经确定“犯人能神出鬼没地出入大屋内的房间”的情况下，我们必须集中精力，保护自己活到明天。」
Indonesian (IDN): "...At any rate, this is no time to quarrel. ...Now that we are certain the culprit can enter and leave the mansion at will and strike out of nowhere, we must give our undivided attention to surviving until tomorrow."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Ad ogni modo, non è questo il momento per essere in disaccordo. ... Ora che abbiamo la certezza che il colpevole può uscire ed entrare dalla casa secondo la sua volontà e comparire dovunque, noi dobbiamo dirigere la nostra attenzione totale alla sopravvivenza fino a domani."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...In ogni caso, questo non è il momento di litigare tra di noi... Ora che siamo certi che il colpevole può entrare e uscire dalla villa per comparire a suo piacimento, dobbiamo dare la massima priorità al sopravvivere fino a domani."
Turkish (TR): "......Her neyse, şimdi kavganın zamanı değil. ......Artık katilin malikaneye istediği gibi girip çıkabileceğinden ve aniden saldırabileceğinden emin olduğumuza göre, tüm dikkatimizi yarına kadar hayatta kalmaya vermeliyiz."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...I agree strongly with Aunt Natsuhi. ...We can figure out who the culprit is at our leisure tonight. For now though, we're better off finding a place to barricade ourselves in."
Umineko Project (UP): "...I agree strongly with Aunt Natsuhi. ......We can take our time racking our brains over the culprit later tonight. For now, we should consider where to barricade ourselves in."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...I agree strongly with Natsuhi oba-san. ......Tonight, we can put off searching for the culprit. Instead, it would be better to think of where we can barricade ourselves in."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…夏妃伯母さんに極めて同感だぜ。……犯人探しは今夜、ゆっくりできるさ。今はどこで篭城するかを考えた方がいい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…夏妃伯母さんに極めて同感だぜ。……犯人探しは今夜、ゆっくりできるさ。今はどこで篭城するかを考えた方がいい」
Russian (RU): "...Я согласен с тётей Нацухи. ......Сегодня мы можем отложить поиски преступника. Вместо этого нам лучше подумать о том, где мы можем забаррикадироваться."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Eu concordo fortemente com a tia Natsuhi. ......Nós podemos perder nosso tempo torturando nossos cérebros pensando no culpado mais tarde. Por ora, devemos considerar onde vamos nos abrigar."
Vietnamese (VI): "...I agree strongly with Aunt Natsuhi. ......We can take our time racking our brains over the culprit later tonight. For now, we should consider where to barricade ourselves in."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…我無比贊同夏妃伯母的想法。……找犯人的事，今晚可以慢慢來。現在先想想去哪裡籠城堅守比較好。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…我无比赞同夏妃伯母的想法。……找犯人的事，今晚可以慢慢来。现在先想想去哪里笼城坚守比较好。」
Indonesian (IDN): "...I agree strongly with Aunt Natsuhi. ...We can figure out who the culprit is at our leisure tonight. For now though, we're better off finding a place to barricade ourselves in."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Sono pienamente d'accordo con Natsuhi oba-san. ... Per stanotte possiamo smetterla di cercare il colpevole. Al contrario, sarebbe meglio pensare ad un luogo nel quale possiamo barricarci dentro."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Sono in totale accordo con zia Natsuhi... Potremo scoprire chi è il colpevole stasera, con tutta la calma del mondo. Ma ora è meglio trovare un posto in cui barricarci."
Turkish (TR): "...Natsuhi Teyze'ye kesinlikle katılıyorum. ......Suçluyu bulmak için gecenin ilerleyen saatlerinde kafa patlatabiliriz. Şimdilik nereye kapanacağımızı düşünmeliyiz."

Steam (ST): As I said this, I pointed out the clock to everyone.
Umineko Project (UP): As I said this, I pointed out the clock to everyone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As I said this, I pointed out the clock to everyone.

Steam (ST): It was already 8:00 at night. ...We had been receiving shocks over and over again since the early morning, and our bodies and minds were both completely tired out.
Umineko Project (UP): It was already eight at night. ...We had been receiving shocks over and over again since the early morning, and both our bodies and our minds were completely tired out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was already 8:00 at night....We had been receiving shocks over and over again since the early morning, and both our bodies and our minds were completely tired out.
PC Japanese (JP): もう夜の８時を回っている。…朝早くから俺たちは次々とショックを受け続け、身も心も疲れ切っていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): もう夜の８時を回っている。…朝早くから俺たちは次々とショックを受け続け、身も心も疲れ切っていた。
Russian (RU): Уже было ровно восемь часов вечера. ...С раннего утра мы оказывались шокированы вновь и вновь, из‐за чего наши тела и умы были истощены.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Já eram oito da noite. ...Nós estamos sendo pegos de surpresa repetidamente desde o início da manhã, e tanto nossos corpos como nossas mentes estão completamente exaustos.
Vietnamese (VI): It was already eight at night. ...We had been receiving shocks over and over again since the early morning, and both our bodies and our minds were completely tired out.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 時針已略過了晚上八點。…從一大早開始，我們接二連三遭受打擊，身心早已疲憊不堪了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 时针已略过了晚上八点。…从一大早开始，我们接二连三遭受打击，身心早已疲惫不堪了。
Indonesian (IDN): It was already 8:00 at night. ...We had been receiving shocks over and over again since the early morning, and our bodies and minds were both completely tired out.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erano già le otto di sera. ... Abbiamo continuato a subire continui traumi sin dalla mattina presto e sia i nostri corpi che le nostri menti erano del tutto esausti.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Erano già le otto di sera... Fin dal mattino presto avevamo subito numerosi traumi, ed eravamo completamente sfiniti sia fisicamente che mentalmente...
Turkish (TR): Saat çoktan akşamın sekiziydi. ...Sabahın erken saatlerinden beri tekrar tekrar şok geçiriyorduk ve hem bedenlerimiz hem de zihinlerimiz tamamen yorulmuştu.

Steam (ST): ...There's still a long, long time until tomorrow. We needed to find some place to barricade ourselves in so we could rest our bodies and get even the smallest amount of relief...
Umineko Project (UP): ......There was still a long, long time until tomorrow. We needed to find some place to barricade ourselves in, somewhere we could rest our bodies and feel even the slightest bit safe...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......There was still a long, long time until tomorrow. We needed to find some place to barricade ourselves in so we could rest our bodies and get even the smallest amount of relief...
PC Japanese (JP): ……明日まではまだまだ長い。体を休められ、最低限の安心ができる篭城場所を見つけなければならない…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……明日まではまだまだ長い。体を休められ、最低限の安心ができる篭城場所を見つけなければならない…。
Russian (RU): ......Но до завтрашнего дня было ещё очень‐очень много времени. Нам нужно найти какое‐то место, в котором мы бы могли забаррикадироваться, чтобы дать своим телам немного отдыха и почувствовать хотя бы небольшое облегчение...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ainda havia muito, muito tempo até amanhã. Precisávamos encontrar um lugar para nos abrigar, algum lugar onde pudéssemos descansar nossos corpos e nos sentirmos pelo menos um pouco seguros...
Vietnamese (VI): ......There was still a long, long time until tomorrow. We needed to find some place to barricade ourselves in, somewhere we could rest our bodies and feel even the slightest bit safe...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……還有很長時間才到明天。必須找到一個可以休息身體，提供最低限度的安全感的據守場所…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……还有很长时间才到明天。必须找到一个可以休息身体，提供最低限度的安全感的据守场所…。
Indonesian (IDN): ...There's still a long, long time until tomorrow. We needed to find some place to barricade ourselves in so we could rest our bodies and get even the smallest amount of relief...
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Restava ancora molto, molto tempo prima che arrivasse domani. {n}Avevamo bisogno di trovare un luogo nel quale barricarci dentro, così da poterci riposare un po' e avere un minimo di sollievo...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Mancava molto tempo fino a domani. Dovevamo trovare un posto in cui asserragliarci, in modo da poter riposare e avere un minimo di sollievo...
Turkish (TR): ......Yarına kadar daha çok ama çok uzun bir zaman vardı. Kendimize barikat kurabileceğimiz bir yer bulmamız gerekiyordu; bedenlerimizi dinlendirebileceğimiz ve kendimizi birazcık da olsa güvende hissedebileceğimiz bir yer...

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Steam (ST): "......I agree... Everyone is already pushing their mental and physical limits, myself included. I believe it would be wise to take that into account as we move forward..."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I agree... Everyone is already pushing their mental and physical limits, myself included. I believe it would be wise to consider our plans immediately..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........I agree... Everyone is already pushing their mental and physical limits, myself included. I believe it would be wise to take that into account..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………私も同感ですな…。私も含め、もうみんな体も心も限界まで打ちのめされています。今からそれを考えた方が賢明でしょうな…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………私も同感ですな…。私も含め、もうみんな体も心も限界まで打ちのめされています。今からそれを考えた方が賢明でしょうな…」
Russian (RU): ".........Я согласен... Все, включая меня самого, находятся на пределе как моральных, так и физических сил. Я думаю, будет мудрым решением принять это в расчёт..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Eu concordo... Todos já estão forçando seus limites mentais e físicos, inclusive eu. Eu acredito que seria sábio considerar nossos planos imediatamente..."
Vietnamese (VI): ".........I agree... Everyone is already pushing their mental and physical limits, myself included. I believe it would be wise to consider our plans immediately..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………我也是同感啊…。包括我在內，大家的身心都已經瀕臨崩潰了。現在還是先考慮這個比較明智吧…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我也是同感啊…。包括我在内，大家的身心都已经濒临崩溃了。现在还是先考虑这个比较明智吧…」
Indonesian (IDN): "......I agree... Everyone is already pushing their mental and physical limits, myself included. I believe it would be wise to take that into account as we move forward..."

Steam (ST): Plus, Grandfather couldn't even have used that trick unless he "knew that the receipt was wedged in the door".

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): ...The moment we try to use a math-based theory to predict someone's actions, we must be aware that our theory has built-in weaknesses and limits. ...Simply put, chessboard thinking is extremely weak against noise and fickleness, as well as mistakes or incorrect knowledge."

Chinese Simplified (CN): …也就是说，……如果对敌人下了错误的判断，那么推理出的答案就全是毫无根据的无稽之谈…。

Steam (ST): So far, I've used chessboard theory to guess several vague bits of information about the culprit hiding behind this case, or so I think.
Umineko Project (UP): Many times, I'd thought that by using chessboard thinking, I had gotten a glimpse into the person behind these crimes.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Many times, I've thought that by using chessboard thinking, I could perceive the plans of the person hiding behind this case.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺はチェス盤思考で、事件の裏に潜む何者かの輪郭を、何度か捉えたような気でいる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 俺はチェス盤思考で、事件の裏に潜む何者かの輪郭を、何度か捉えたような気でいる。

Steam (ST): But the fatigue and hunger were even harsher than we'd imagined.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): But the fatigue and hunger were even harsher than we had imagined.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、疲労と空腹は想像する以上に辛いものだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、疲労と空腹は想像する以上に辛いものだった。
Russian (RU): Но усталость и голод всё серьёзней давали знать о себе, причём куда сильней, чем мы себе представляли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas a fadiga e a fome eram ainda mais duras do que imaginávamos.
Vietnamese (VI): But the fatigue and hunger were even harsher than we had imagined.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，疲勞和飢餓比想像中還要難熬。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，疲劳和饥饿比想象中还要难熬。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Ma la stanchezza e la fame erano più dure di quanto avessimo immaginato...
Turkish (TR): Ancak yorgunluk ve açlık hayal ettiğimizden daha da zorluydu.

Steam (ST): ...Then, Kumasawa-san made a proposal, and we all went together to the kitchen. There, we gathered some canned food and other things that'd be hard to poison to take in with us.
Umineko Project (UP): ......So, on Kumasawa‐san's suggestion, we all went along together to the kitchen, and gathered some canned food, which would be hard to poison, to take in with us.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Then, we all went along with Kumasawa-san's proposal to go together to the kitchen, and gathered some canned food, which would be hard to poison, to take in with us.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そこで熊沢さんの提案で、みんなで一緒に厨房へ行き、缶詰などの毒物混入を疑い難いものを集めて持ち込もうということになった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……そこで熊沢さんの提案で、みんなで一緒に厨房へ行き、缶詰などの毒物混入を疑い難いものを集めて持ち込もうということになった。
Russian (RU): ......Тогда мы согласились с предложением Кумасавы‐сан сходить всем вместе на кухню и собрать консервированную еду, которую будет трудно отравить, и взять её с собой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Então, por sugestão da Kumasawa‐san, todos fomos juntos para a cozinha, e recolhemos alguns alimentos enlatados, que seriam difíceis de envenenar, para levar conosco.
Vietnamese (VI): ......So, on Kumasawa‐san's suggestion, we all went along together to the kitchen, and gathered some canned food, which would be hard to poison, to take in with us.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……因此在熊澤婆婆的提案下，大家一起去了一趟廚房，挑選了一些罐頭之類難以下毒的食物，一起拿到書房去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……因此在熊泽婆婆的提案下，大家一起去了一趟厨房，挑选了一些罐头之类难以下毒的食物，一起拿到书房去。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Then, Kumasawa-san made a proposal, and we all went together to the kitchen. There, we gathered some canned food and other things that'd be hard to poison to take in with us.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Seguimmo tutti la proposta di Kumasawa di andare insieme in cucina, e raccogliere del cibo in scatola, che sarebbe stato difficile da avvelenare, da portare con noi.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sotto proposta di Kumasawa-san, ci dirigemmo insieme in cucina, per procurarci del cibo in scatola, in cui era molto più improbabile aggiungerci del veleno, e altri alimenti del genere da poter portare con noi.
Turkish (TR): ......Bu yüzden Kumasawa-san'ın önerisi üzerine hep birlikte mutfağa gittik, ve yanımıza almak üzere zehirlenmesi zor olan konserve yiyecekler topladık.

Steam (ST): All of Kumasawa-san's efforts to reward us with just a little dinner on this savage day regrettably came to nothing...
Umineko Project (UP): All of Kumasawa‐san's efforts to reward us with at least a nice dinner on this savage day regrettably came to nothing...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All of Kumasawa-san's efforts to reward us with just a little dinner on this savage day regrettably came to nothing...
PC Japanese (JP): このような殺伐とした一日を、せめて夕食でだけはねぎらいたいという熊沢さんの努力は、このような気の毒な形で水泡に帰す…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): このような殺伐とした一日を、せめて夕食でだけはねぎらいたいという熊沢さんの努力は、このような気の毒な形で水泡に帰す…。
Russian (RU): Все старания Кумасавы‐сан, пытавшейся хотя бы чуть‐чуть наградить нас небольшим ужином за весь этот дикий день, к сожалению, пошли прахом...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos os esforços da Kumasawa‐san para nos recompensar com, pelo menos, um bom jantar neste dia brutal, lamentavelmente foram em vão...
Vietnamese (VI): All of Kumasawa‐san's efforts to reward us with at least a nice dinner on this savage day regrettably came to nothing...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這一天劍拔弩張，熊澤婆婆本想用晚飯慰勞大家，這份心意卻以這種可怜的形式化為了泡影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这一天剑拔弩张，熊泽婆婆本想用晚饭慰劳大家，这份心意却以这种可怜的形式化为了泡影。
Indonesian (IDN): All of Kumasawa-san's efforts to reward us with just a little dinner on this savage day regrettably came to nothing...
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tutti gli sforzi di Kumasawa-san per almeno ricompensarci con una cena in questa barbara giornata purtroppo vennero annullati...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Gli sforzi di Kumasawa-san, compiuti per cercare quantomeno di tirarci su con una semplice cena, dopo una giornata tanto angosciante, andarono in fumo in modo poco cerimonioso...
Turkish (TR): Kumasawa-san'ın bu vahşi günde bizi en azından güzel bir akşam yemeği ile ödüllendirmek için gösterdiği tüm çabalar ne yazık ki boşa çıktı...

Steam (ST): The food piled up on the serving cart looked just a little sad.
Umineko Project (UP): The food piled up on the serving cart looked just a little sad.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The food piled up on the serving cart looked just a little sad.
PC Japanese (JP): 配膳台車に積み込まれた食事が少しだけ悲しかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 配膳台車に積み込まれた食事が少しだけ悲しかった。
Russian (RU): Пища, сложенная на сервировочную тележку, выглядела несколько грустно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A comida empilhada no carrinho auxiliar parecia um pouco triste.
Vietnamese (VI): The food piled up on the serving cart looked just a little sad.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 擺在餐車上的食物略顯淒涼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 摆在餐车上的食物略显凄凉。
Indonesian (IDN): The food piled up on the serving cart looked just a little sad.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Era un po' triste vedere il cibo disposto sul portavivande.
Turkish (TR): Servis arabasının üzerine yığılmış yiyecekler biraz acınası görünüyordu.

Steam (ST): We all started climbing the stairs. Aunt Natsuhi, who was in the lead, warily stared into the darkness with both eyes and the barrel of the gun.
Umineko Project (UP): We all started climbing the stairs. Aunt Natsuhi led the group, warily staring into the darkness with both eyes and the barrel of the gun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We all started climbing the stairs. Natsuhi oba-san, who was in the lead, warily stared into the darkness with both eyes and the barrel of the gun.
PC Japanese (JP): みんなで階段を上がっていく。先頭は夏妃伯母さんで、用心深く暗がりを両眼と銃口で睨み付けた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): みんなで階段を上がっていく。先頭は夏妃伯母さんで、用心深く暗がりを両眼と銃口で睨み付けた。
Russian (RU): Мы стали подниматься по лестнице. Тётя Нацухи, шедшая во главе, осторожно вглядывалась в темноту одновременно обоими глазами и дулом ружья.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos começamos a subir as escadas. A tia Natsuhi conduziu o grupo, olhando cautelosamente na escuridão com ambos os olhos e o cano da arma apontado.
Vietnamese (VI): We all started climbing the stairs. Aunt Natsuhi led the group, warily staring into the darkness with both eyes and the barrel of the gun.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大家沿著樓梯往上走。領頭的夏妃伯母，謹慎地用雙眼和槍口戒備暗處。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大家沿着楼梯往上走。领头的夏妃伯母，谨慎地用双眼和枪口戒备暗处。
Indonesian (IDN): We all started climbing the stairs. Aunt Natsuhi, who was in the lead, warily stared into the darkness with both eyes and the barrel of the gun.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Cominciammo a salire le scale. Natsuhi oba-san, che era davanti, fissava attentamente il buio con entrambi gli occhi e la canna del fucile.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Iniziammo a salire le scale. Zia Natsuhi, che era a capo della fila, scrutava nel buio, con sguardo vigile e fucile pronto.
Turkish (TR): Hepimiz merdivenleri çıkmaya başladık. Natsuhi Teyze grubun önündeydi, iki gözü ve silahının namlusuyla karanlığa dikkatle bakıyordu.

Steam (ST): Once we'd dragged ourselves up to the third floor, just as Aunt Natsuhi had warned us of beforehand, ...there was a mixture of a chemical smell and a sickly-sweet aroma, a stench hanging in the air that felt like it was eating into our heads.
Umineko Project (UP): When we arrived on the third floor, just as Aunt Natsuhi had warned us beforehand, there was a mixture of a chemical smell and a sickly sweet aroma, a stench hanging in the air that felt like it was eating into our heads.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Once we'd dragged ourselves up to the third floor, just as Natsuhi oba-san had warned us of beforehand... there was a mixture of a chemical smell and a sickly-sweet aroma, a stench hanging in the air that felt like it was eating into our heads.
PC Japanese (JP): ３階に辿り着くと、事前に夏妃伯母さんに脅されていた通り、薬品系の臭いと甘ったるい臭いの入り混じった、脳を蝕むような臭いが漂ってくるのを感じた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ３階に辿り着くと、事前に夏妃伯母さんに脅されていた通り、薬品系の臭いと甘ったるい臭いの入り混じった、脳を蝕むような臭いが漂ってくるのを感じた。
Russian (RU): Как только мы дотащились до третьего этажа, то, как тётя Нацухи нас заранее и предупреждала, наши носы ощутили смесь запаха каких‐то химикатов и болезненно‐сладкого аромата, и вонь, повисшая в воздухе, как будто бы въедалась в наши мозги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando chegamos no terceiro andar, tal como a tia Natsuhi nos havia avisado de antemão, havia uma mistura de um cheiro químico e um aroma doce doentio, um fedor no ar que parecia como se fosse apodrecer nossas mentes.
Vietnamese (VI): When we arrived on the third floor, just as Aunt Natsuhi had warned us beforehand, there was a mixture of a chemical smell and a sickly sweet aroma, a stench hanging in the air that felt like it was eating into our heads.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一到三樓，就如同夏妃伯母事先警告的一樣，藥味和甜味混在一起，一股仿彿要腐蝕掉大腦般的臭味迎面撲來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一到三楼，就如同夏妃伯母事先警告的一样，药味和甜味混在一起，一股仿佛要腐蚀掉大脑般的臭味迎面扑来。
Indonesian (IDN): Once we'd dragged ourselves up to the third floor, just as Aunt Natsuhi had warned us of beforehand, ...there was a mixture of a chemical smell and a sickly-sweet aroma, a stench hanging in the air that felt like it was eating into our heads.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Una volta che ci fummo trascinati fino al secondo piano, proprio come ci aveva precedente avvertito Natsuhi oba-san... ci fu un misto di odore di sostanze chimiche e di un aroma dolciastro, un fetore stazionato nell'aria che sembrava ci penetrasse la testa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Una volta raggiunto il secondo piano, fiutammo degli odori, proprio come zia Natsuhi in precedenza ci aveva fatto temere... un miscuglio tra un tanfo di medicinali e un fetore dolciastro, che aleggiavano nell'aria.
Turkish (TR): Üçüncü kata vardığımızda, tıpkı Natsuhi Teyze'nin bizi önceden uyardığı gibi, kimyasal bir koku ile hastalıklı tatlı bir aromanın karışımından oluşan, havada asılı duran ve sanki kafamızı kemiriyormuş gibi hissettiren pis bir koku vardı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...I see, this kind of stench probably would give you a headache if you were shut in with it for a whole night. ...I know it's a little late, but I'm with Jessica. I vote against going into Grandfather's study."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Yeah, this kind of stench probably would give you a headache if you were shut in with it for a whole night. ...I know it's a little late, but I find myself siding with Jessica against going into Grandfather's study."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I see, this kind of stench probably would give you a headache if you were shut in with it for a whole night. ...I know it's a little late, but I'm with Jessica. I vote against going into Grandfather's study."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……なるほど、こりゃ一晩も篭ったら頭痛にでもなりそうな臭いだな。…今さらながら、祖父さまの書斎に反対した朱志香に賛成だぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……なるほど、こりゃ一晩も篭ったら頭痛にでもなりそうな臭いだな。…今さらながら、祖父さまの書斎に反対した朱志香に賛成だぜ」
Russian (RU): "......Ясно, от такой вонищи, как пить дать, голова разболится, если ты будешь вынужден вдыхать её, запершись на всю ночь. ...Я знаю, что уже немного поздно давать задний ход, но я за Джессику и голосую против того, чтобы идти в кабинет дедушки."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Entendo, esse tipo de fedor provavelmente lhe daria uma dor de cabeça se você ficasse trancado com ele por uma noite inteira. ...Eu sei que é um pouco tarde, mas acho que estou ficando do lado de Jessica por estar contra entrar no quarto do vovô."
Vietnamese (VI): "......Yeah, this kind of stench probably would give you a headache if you were shut in with it for a whole night. ...I know it's a little late, but I find myself siding with Jessica against going into Grandfather's study."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……原來如此，在這臭味裡守一晚肯定會頭疼的吧。…雖說是馬後炮，但我現在贊成反對來爺爺書房的朱志香了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……原来如此，在这臭味里守一晚肯定会头疼的吧。…虽说是马后炮，但我现在赞成反对来爷爷书房的朱志香了。」
Indonesian (IDN): "...I see, this kind of stench probably would give you a headache if you were shut in with it for a whole night. ...I know it's a little late, but I'm with Jessica. I vote against going into Grandfather's study."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Capisco, questo genere di tanfo probabilmente ti procurerebbe un mal di testa se vi fossi chiuso dentro una notte intera. ... So che è un po' tardi, ma io sono con Jessica. Voto contro l'andare nello studio del Nonno."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Capisco, con una puzza del genere, se dovessi stare chiuso qui per una notte, probabilmente mi verrebbe il mal di testa... So che è tardi per dirlo, ma sono a favore di Jessica per non entrare nello studio del nonno."
Turkish (TR): "......Anlıyorum, bu tür bir kokuyla bütün bir gece kapalı kalsaydınız muhtemelen başınızı çok ağrıtırdı. ...Biliyorum biraz geç oldu ama Büyükbabanın çalışma odasına girmeme konusunda Jessica'ya katılıyorum."

Steam (ST): It felt like the stench was floating out from this magnificent door.
Umineko Project (UP): This exceptionally magnificent door felt like the source of the stench.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It felt like the stench was floating out from this magnificent door.

Vietnamese (VI): This exceptionally magnificent door felt like the source of the stench.

Steam (ST): While Genji-san unlocked the door, Maria stared at the door and the doorknob with great interest.
Umineko Project (UP): While Genji‐san was unlocking the door, Maria was staring at the door and the doorknob with great interest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): While Genji-san was unlocking the door, Maria was staring at the door and the doorknob with great interest.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "It looks old and strict and like it'd stop any jokes cold. A perfect door for Grandfather's study."
Umineko Project (UP): "It looks old and strict and like it'd stop any jokes cold—sure is a fitting door for Grandfather's study."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It looks old and strict and like it'd stop any jokes cold. Sure is a fitting door for Grandfather's study."

Steam (ST): When the door was closed, it automatically made a *clunk*. ...I see, this is the auto-lock that's activated whenever the door is closed...
Umineko Project (UP): When the door closed, it automatically made a clunk.{n}...I see, this is the auto‐lock that's activated whenever the door is closed...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the door was closed, it automatically made a *clunk*....I see, this is the auto-lock that's activated whenever the door is closed...
PC Japanese (JP): 扉が閉まると、自動的にガチャンという音がする。…なるほど、閉じると自動的に閉まるオートロックというわけか…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 扉が閉まると、自動的にガチャンという音がする。{n}…なるほど、閉じると自動的に閉まるオートロックというわけか…。
Russian (RU): Когда дверь закрылась, она издала глухой звук *клац*.{n}...Ясно, это автоблокировка, которая срабатывает каждый раз, когда дверь закрывается...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a porta se fechou, automaticamente fez um barulho.{n}...Entendi, esse é o bloqueio automático que é ativado sempre que a porta é fechada...
Vietnamese (VI): When the door closed, it automatically made a clunk.{n}...I see, this is the auto‐lock that's activated whenever the door is closed...

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando la porta venne chiusa, si sentì immediatamente un *clunk*. {n}Capisco, quella era la chiusura automatica che si attivava ogni volta che la porta veniva chiusa...
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Quando la porta venne chiusa, si sentì il suono di un ‘clank’ meccanico...{n}Certo, era la serratura automatica che si attivava ogni volta che la porta veniva chiusa...
Turkish (TR): Kapı kapandığında otomatik olarak bir takırtı sesi çıkardı.{n}...Anlıyorum, bu kapı her kapandığında devreye giren otomatik kilit...

Steam (ST): And there were only two keys that could open this door from the outside, both of which were in this room. ...In other words, it had become a "closed room".
Umineko Project (UP): And there were only two keys which could open this door from the outside, both of which were in this room. ......In other words, this room had become a "locked room".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And there were only two keys which could open this door from the outside, both of which were in this room. ......In other words, this room had become a 'closed room'.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてこの扉を外から開けられる鍵は２本しかなく、その２本が今この室内に存在している。……つまり、この部屋はこれで“密室”になったのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そしてこの扉を外から開けられる鍵は２本しかなく、その２本が今この室内に存在している。……つまり、この部屋はこれで“密室”になったのだ。
Russian (RU): И к ней имелось два ключа, отпирающих её снаружи, находящихся в нашем распоряжении в этой комнате. ......Другими словами, эта комната была "запертой комнатой".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E só haviam duas chaves que podiam abrir essa porta do lado de fora, as duas estavam nesse quarto. ......Em outras palavras, esse quarto tinha se tornado um "quarto fechado".
Vietnamese (VI): And there were only two keys which could open this door from the outside, both of which were in this room. ......In other words, this room had become a "locked room".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且能從外面打開這門的鑰匙只有兩把，這兩把現在都在室內。……也就是說，這房間就此成為“密室”了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且能从外面打开这门的钥匙只有两把，这两把现在都在室内。……也就是说，这房间就此成为“密室”了。
Indonesian (IDN): And there were only two keys that could open this door from the outside, both of which were in this room. ...In other words, it had become a "closed room".
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E vi erano solo due chiavi che avrebbero potuto aprire quella porta dall'esterno, ed entrambe erano all'interno della stanza stessa. ... In altre parole, questa stanza era appena diventata una ‘stanza chiusa’.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): E vi erano solo due chiavi che avrebbero potuto aprire quella porta dall'esterno, ed entrambe erano all'interno della stanza stessa... In altre parole, quella stanza era diventata una ‘camera chiusa’...
Turkish (TR): Ve bu kapıyı dışarıdan açabilecek sadece iki anahtar vardı ve ikisi de bu odadaydı. ......Diğer bir deyişle, bu oda "kilitli bir oda" haline gelmişti.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): La serranda, lo scontrino, la catenella... E ora, la chiusura automatica...
Turkish (TR): .........Kepenk, fiş, zincir.{n}......Ve şimdi de, otomatik kilit.

Steam (ST): ...This fourth door had the most magnificent lock yet, and this was doubtlessly a closed room.
Umineko Project (UP): ...This fourth door had been locked in the most magnificent fashion yet, constructing a locked room in a perfect form that none could argue with.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...This fourth door had the most magnificent lock yet, and this was doubtlessly a closed room.
PC Japanese (JP): …四度目の扉はそれまでで最高の形で施錠され、文句のない形で密室を構成してくれた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …四度目の扉はそれまでで最高の形で施錠され、文句のない形で密室を構成してくれた。
Russian (RU): ...Данная четвёртая дверь обладала самым странным замком, однако несомненно образовывала идеальную запертую комнату, с которой бы сложно было поспорить.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Essa quarta porta tinha sido bloqueada da forma mais magnífica possível, construindo um quarto fechado de forma perfeita de maneira que ninguém poderia discutir.
Vietnamese (VI): ...This fourth door had been locked in the most magnificent fashion yet, constructing a locked room in a perfect form that none could argue with.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …第四次的門，以至今為止最穩固的方式上鎖，以無可非議的形式構成了密室。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La quarta porta è stata chiusa in un modo magnifico, e si trattava senza dubbio di una stanza chiusa.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Questa quarta porta aveva la migliore delle serrature, e formava inequivocabilmente una camera chiusa.
Turkish (TR): ...Bu dördüncü kapı şimdiye kadarki en görkemli şekilde kilitlenerek, kimsenin itiraz edemeyeceği mükemmel bir kilitli oda meydana getirmişti.

Steam (ST): Just to make absolutely sure that the room was secure, we checked all over for ways in or out.
Umineko Project (UP): Just to make absolutely sure that the room was secure, we checked all over for ways in or out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just to make absolutely sure that the room was secure, we checked all over for ways in or out.
PC Japanese (JP): それをより確実に確認するため、まず最初に部屋全体の戸締り確認から行なわれた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それをより確実に確認するため、まず最初に部屋全体の戸締り確認から行なわれた。
Russian (RU): Просто чтобы окончательно убедиться, что в комнате было безопасно, мы проверили все пути входа и выхода.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Só para ter certeza absoluta de que o quarto estava seguro, verificamos todas as maneiras de entrar ou sair.
Vietnamese (VI): Just to make absolutely sure that the room was secure, we checked all over for ways in or out.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per poter accertarcene in maniera definitiva, come prima cosa controllammo in tutta la stanza che le porte e le finestre fossero chiuse.
Turkish (TR): Odanın güvenli olduğundan kesinlikle emin olabilmek için tüm giriş ve çıkış yollarını kontrol ettik.

Steam (ST): The window was tightly locked. That should've been enough, but just in case, we tried knocking all over the walls.
Umineko Project (UP): The windows were tightly locked. That should have been enough, but just in case, we tried knocking all over the walls.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The window was tightly locked. That should have been enough, but just in case, we tried knocking all over the walls.
PC Japanese (JP): 窓はしっかり施錠されていた。ならこれで完璧なのだが、念には念を入れて壁をぐるりと叩いてみる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 窓はしっかり施錠されていた。ならこれで完璧なのだが、念には念を入れて壁をぐるりと叩いてみる。

Vietnamese (VI): The windows were tightly locked. That should have been enough, but just in case, we tried knocking all over the walls.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Le finestre erano completamente chiuse. Sarebbe bastato quello, ma per essere completamente sicuri, picchiettammo intorno a tutti i muri...
Turkish (TR): Pencereler sıkıca kilitlenmişti. Bu yeterli olmalıydı ama her ihtimale karşı duvarlara vurmayı denedik.

Steam (ST): ...After all, we had talked about there being a hidden door in this room. ...But we couldn't find anything suspicious.
Umineko Project (UP): ......After all, there had been whispers that there might be a hidden door in this room.{n}...But we couldn't find anything suspicious.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......After all, it was rumored that there might be a hidden door in this room....But we couldn't find anything suspicious.
PC Japanese (JP): ……隠し扉があるのではないかと囁かれたからだ。…だが不審な点は見つけられなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……隠し扉があるのではないかと囁かれたからだ。{n}…だが不審な点は見つけられなかった。
Russian (RU): ......В конце концов, ходили слухи, что в этой комнате имелась потайная дверь.{n}...Но мы не могли найти ничего подозрительного.

Vietnamese (VI): ......After all, there had been whispers that there might be a hidden door in this room.{n}...But we couldn't find anything suspicious.

Indonesian (IDN): ...After all, we had talked about there being a hidden door in this room. ...But we couldn't find anything suspicious.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): D'altronde, si vociferava che potesse esserci una porta segreta... Ma non riuscimmo a trovare nulla di sospetto.
Turkish (TR): ......Ne de olsa, bu odada gizli bir kapı olabileceğine dair söylentiler vardı.{n}...Ama şüpheli bir şey bulamadık.

Steam (ST): Grandfather's study was very large. Even though we called it a study, it wasn't really a single room.
Umineko Project (UP): Grandfather's study was very large.{n}Even though we called it a study, it wasn't really a single room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Grandfather's study was very large. Even though we called it a study, it wasn't really a single room.
PC Japanese (JP): 祖父さまの書斎はとても大きかった。書斎といっても一部屋ではない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 祖父さまの書斎はとても大きかった。{n}書斎といっても一部屋ではない。
Russian (RU): Дедушкин кабинет был очень большим.{n}Хотя мы и называли эту комнату кабинетом, на самом деле это была не одна комната.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O quarto do vovô era muito grande.{n}Embora o chamássemos de quarto, não era realmente um simples quarto.
Vietnamese (VI): Grandfather's study was very large.{n}Even though we called it a study, it wasn't really a single room.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 爺爺的書房非常大。{n}雖說是書房，卻不止一個房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 爷爷的书房非常大。{n}虽说是书房，却不止一个房间。
Indonesian (IDN): Grandfather's study was very large. Even though we called it a study, it wasn't really a single room.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lo studio del Nonno era molto grande. Anche se veniva chiamato studio, non era realmente una singola stanza.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Lo studio del nonno era molto vasto. Anche se era definito come uno studio, non era composto da una singola stanza.
Turkish (TR): Büyükbabamın çalışma odası çok genişti.{n}Biz ona çalışma odası desek de aslında tek bir oda değildi.

Steam (ST): It could be divided up into four basic sections: a study section, a bedroom section, a toilet/bathroom section and a section for cooking that had a sink.
Umineko Project (UP): It could be divided up into four basic sections: a study section, a bedroom section, a toilet/bathroom section and a section for cooking that had a sink.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It could be divided up into four basic sections: a study section, a bedroom section, a toilet/bathroom section and a section for cooking that had a sink.
PC Japanese (JP): そこは簡単に区分すると、書斎部分と寝室部分、トイレ・風呂部分と賄い用の流し部分の４区画となっていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そこは簡単に区分すると、書斎部分と寝室部分、トイレ・風呂部分と賄い用の流し部分の４区画となっていた。
Russian (RU): Её можно поделить на четыре основные секции: секция кабинета, секция спальни, секция туалета/ванной и кухонная секция, в которой была раковина.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Poderia ser dividido em quatro seções básicas: uma seção de estudos, uma seção para dormir, uma seção com banheiro e uma seção para cozinhar que também tinha uma pia.
Vietnamese (VI): It could be divided up into four basic sections: a study section, a bedroom section, a toilet/bathroom section and a section for cooking that had a sink.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 把這裡簡單地划區，可以分為書房部分和臥室部分，以及廁所浴室部分和準備食物用的水池部分，總共四個區域。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 把这里简单地划区，可以分为书房部分和卧室部分，以及厕所浴室部分和准备食物用的水池部分，总共四个区域。
Indonesian (IDN): It could be divided up into four basic sections: a study section, a bedroom section, a toilet/bathroom section and a section for cooking that had a sink.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per dividerlo in modo semplice, vi erano quattro sezioni: una sezione per lo studio, una per dormire, un bagno, e una sezione per cucinare, con tanto di lavello.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Per suddividerlo in maniera semplice, vi erano quattro sezioni: uno studio, una camera da letto, un bagno con toilette, e un'area con un lavello da cucina.
Turkish (TR): Dört temel kısma ayrılabilirdi: çalışma kısmı, yatak odası kısmı, tuvalet/banyo kısmı ve yemek pişirmek için içerisinde lavabo bulunan bir kısım.

Steam (ST): I see, this study really does have enough in it to live in. ...Now I see how Grandfather could live his whole life in this room without ever leaving.
Umineko Project (UP): I see, this study does have enough in it to live in.{n}...Now I could understand how Grandfather could live his whole life in this room without ever leaving.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I see, this study has enough in it to live in....Now I understand how Grandfather could live his whole life in this room without ever leaving.
PC Japanese (JP): なるほど、この書斎だけで充分、生活空間は成立している。…祖父さまがこの部屋を出なくても充分生活ができるのも納得だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): なるほど、この書斎だけで充分、生活空間は成立している。{n}…祖父さまがこの部屋を出なくても充分生活ができるのも納得だった。
Russian (RU): Понятно, в этом кабинете есть всё, чтобы в нём можно было жить.{n}...Теперь я понимаю, как дедушка мог всю жизнь прожить в этой комнате, не покидая её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entendo, esse quarto tem de tudo para viver.{n}...Agora eu entendo como o vovô podia viver toda a sua vida neste quarto sem nunca sair.
Vietnamese (VI): I see, this study does have enough in it to live in.{n}...Now I could understand how Grandfather could live his whole life in this room without ever leaving.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 原來如此，光是這個書房，就已經是一個足夠的生活空間了。{n}…現在我可以理解，為什麼爺爺不從房間出來也能活得好好的了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 原来如此，光是这个书房，就已经是一个足够的生活空间了。{n}…现在我可以理解，为什么爷爷不从房间出来也能活得好好的了。
Indonesian (IDN): I see, this study really does have enough in it to live in. ...Now I see how Grandfather could live his whole life in this room without ever leaving.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Capisco, questo studio aveva tutto il necessario per viverci dentro. ... Riconobbi che il Nonno avrebbe potuto fare un sacco di cose qui dentro senza neanche uscire.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): In effetti, lo studio formava uno spazio abitativo di tutto rispetto... Ci rendemmo conto che il nonno avrebbe potuto viverci bene, senza mai lasciare la stanza.
Turkish (TR): Anlıyorum, bu çalışma odası içinde yaşamak için yeterli.{n}...Büyükbabamın bütün hayatını bu odada hiç çıkmadan nasıl geçirdiğini şimdi anlayabiliyordum.

Steam (ST): It seemed Grandfather wasn't in the habit of watching TV, because there was no television or even a radio in this room.
Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that Grandfather wasn't in the habit of watching TV; there was no television in this room, nor even a radio.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that Grandfather wasn't in the habit of watching TV, because there was no television or even a radio in this room.
PC Japanese (JP): 祖父さまにテレビを見る習慣はなかったらしく、この部屋にはテレビはおろかラジオもなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 祖父さまにテレビを見る習慣はなかったらしく、この部屋にはテレビはおろかラジオもなかった。
Russian (RU): Похоже, дедушка не имел привычки смотреть телевизор, потому что ни телевизора, ни даже радио в этой комнате не было.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que o vovô não tinha o hábito de assistir TV; não havia televisão neste quarto, nem mesmo um rádio.
Vietnamese (VI): It seemed that Grandfather wasn't in the habit of watching TV; there was no television in this room, nor even a radio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 爺爺似乎沒有看電視的習慣，這房間別說電視機了連收音機都沒有。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 爷爷似乎没有看电视的习惯，这房间别说电视机了连收音机都没有。
Indonesian (IDN): It seemed Grandfather wasn't in the habit of watching TV, because there was no television or even a radio in this room.
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembra che al Nonno non piacesse guardare la TV, perché non c'era la televisione, e neanche una vecchia radio.
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Sembrava che il nonno non guardasse la TV, perché non c'era una televisione, e nemmeno una radio...
Turkish (TR): Büyükbabamın televizyon izleme alışkanlığı olmadığı belli oluyordu; bu odada ne televizyon ne de bir radyo vardı.

Steam (ST): Normally, black magic seems like it'd just be creepy, and it's really hard to imagine why someone might be so enraptured by it.
Umineko Project (UP): Before this, his black magic hobby was nothing other than creepy, and we had found it impossible to understand what drove him to devote himself to it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Almost anyone would find it impossible to understand. What could be possibly be so enrapturing about this unpleasant black magic hobby?
PC Japanese (JP): 普通に考えるなら、黒魔術趣味など不気味なだけで、何を考えて傾倒したのかまったく理解できなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 普通に考えるなら、黒魔術趣味など不気味なだけで、何を考えて傾倒したのかまったく理解できなかった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Antes disso, seu hobby de magia negra era nada mais do que assustador, e tínhamos achado impossível entender o que o levou a se dedicar a isso.
Vietnamese (VI): Before this, his black magic hobby was nothing other than creepy, and we had found it impossible to understand what drove him to devote himself to it.

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Normalmente, avrei semplicemente pensato che la sua passione per la magia nera fosse inquietante, e non avrei mai potuto comprendere cosa stesse pensando o a cosa fosse esattamente devoto...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Bruxaria funciona da mesma maneira. ...Você continua rezando sinceramente, esperando por esse resultado quase impossível e improvável. ......Então, quando esse resultado quase impossível se mostra, os sentimentos de todas aquelas preces armazenadas são encarnados através da magia."
Vietnamese (VI): ".........Sorcery works the same way. ...You keep on praying earnestly, hoping for that impossibly unlikely outcome. ......Then, when that impossible result shows itself, the feelings from all those stored up prayers are made incarnate through magic."

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...Anche la magia opera con questo ragionamento... Continuare a pregare ardentemente per un risultato estremamente difficile da ottenere... E quando nei dadi appare un risultato miracoloso, i desideri reconditi di tutte le preghiere accumulate acquisiscono del potere magico, per poi materializzarsi..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "...That's Grandfather... He was burned in the incinerator, and our eyes were so drawn to that part that we didn't notice, ...but his forehead... no, his head had been gouged."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "..."On the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill". ...We thought Kanon-kun's case was an unexpected encounter with the culprit, ......but that's wrong. From the very beginning, they planned to lure someone out alone and drive something through their chest..."
Umineko Project (UP): "...‘On the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill’. ......We thought that Kanon‐kun's case was an unexpected encounter with the culprit, .........but that's wrong. They had been planning on luring someone out alone and driving something through their chest from the beginning..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...'At the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill'. ...We thought that Kanon-kun's case was an unexpected encounter with the culprit, .........but that's wrong. They had been planning on luring someone out alone and driving something through their chest from the beginning..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…“第五の晩に、胸を抉りて殺せ”。……嘉音くんについては、犯人との突発的な遭遇による犯行だと思ってたけど、………違う。誰か一人を誘き出し、胸を貫くことを初めから狙っていたんだ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…“第五の晩に、胸を抉りて殺せ”。……嘉音くんについては、犯人との突発的な遭遇による犯行だと思ってたけど、………違う。誰か一人を誘き出し、胸を貫くことを初めから狙っていたんだ…」
Russian (RU): "...‘К пятым — дыру проделав во груди вращеньем, умертви’. ......Мы думали, что Канон‐кун неожиданно столкнулся с преступником......... но это не так. Они с самого начала планировали заманить кого‐нибудь одного и пробить ему грудь..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...‘No quinto crepúsculo, goive o peito e mate’. ......Nós pensamos que o caso do Kanon‐kun foi um encontro inesperado com o culpado, .........mas isso estava errado. Eles estavam planejando atrair alguém sozinho e atirar algo no peito desde o início..."
Vietnamese (VI): "...‘On the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill’. ......We thought that Kanon‐kun's case was an unexpected encounter with the culprit, .........but that's wrong. They had been planning on luring someone out alone and driving something through their chest from the beginning..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…“第五晚，剜胸殺之。”……關於嘉音君，我本以為是由於和犯人突然遭遇而引發的犯罪，………但看來不是。犯人原本的目的就是要引出一個人，然後剜胸殺之…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…“第五晚，剜胸杀之。”……关于嘉音君，我本以为是由于和犯人突然遭遇而引发的犯罪，………但看来不是。犯人原本的目的就是要引出一个人，然后剜胸杀之…」
Indonesian (IDN): "..."On the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill". ...We thought Kanon-kun's case was an unexpected encounter with the culprit, ......but that's wrong. From the very beginning, they planned to lure someone out alone and drive something through their chest..."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... ‘Al quinto crepuscolo, perfora il petto e uccidi’. ... Abbiamo pensato che il caso di Kanon-kun fosse un incontro inaspettato con il colpevole... ma ci sbagliavamo. Stava architettando di attirare fuori qualcuno da solo e perforargli il petto con qualcosa sin dall'inizio..."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "...‘Al quinto crepuscolo, fora il suo petto e uccidilo’... Con Kanon-kun avevamo pensato che il crimine fosse il risultato di un incontro inaspettato con il colpevole... ma ci sbagliavamo. Stava architettando fin dall'inizio di attirare via qualcuno da solo, per poi trafiggergli il petto..."
Turkish (TR): "...‘Beşinci alacakaranlıkta, göğsünü oy ve öldür’. ......Kanon-kun'un durumunun suçlu ile beklenmedik bir karşılaşma olduğunu düşünmüştük, .........ama bu yanlıştı. Başından beri birini tek başına dışarı çekmeyi ve göğsüne bir şey saplamayı planlıyorlardı..."

Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice} had proclaimed something inside it. She had proclaimed that, according to her contract with Kinzo, she would collect everything of the Ushiromiya family as interest.

There will be no ties. {n}Make sure that you do not misunderstand your current situation.'

There will be no ties.{n}Make sure that you do not misunderstand your current situation.}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): 'Are you enjoying the riddle of Kinzo-sama's epitaph?{n} As you are all probably aware, you have very little time remaining.{n} Please abandon any naive hopes of escaping after the storm passes.{n} This game can only end with my victory or yours.{n} When time runs out, I will win by default. There will be no ties.{n} Make sure that you do not misunderstand your current situation.'
PC Japanese (JP): “金蔵さまの碑文の謎をお楽しみいただいているでしょうか。{n}すでにご存知と思いますが、皆様方には時間が多くは残されてはおりません。{n}どうか、嵐が過ぎ去れば逃げ出すことができるという甘えをお捨て下さいませ。{n}このゲームには、私と皆様方のどちらが勝つかの結果しかない。{n}時間切れは私の勝ちとなる。引き分けはありません。{n}そこをどうか誤解なきようお願い申し上げます”
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): {e:070:“金蔵さまの碑文の謎をお楽しみいただいているでしょうか。{n}すでにご存知と思いますが、皆様方には時間が多くは残されてはおりません。{n}どうか、嵐が過ぎ去れば逃げ出すことができるという甘えをお捨て下さいませ。{n}このゲームには、私と皆様方のどちらが勝つかの結果しかない。{n}時間切れは私の勝ちとなる。引き分けはありません。{n}そこをどうか誤解なきようお願い申し上げます”}
Russian (RU): {e:070:— Как вы находите загадку эпитафии Кинзо‐сама?{n}Вы, должно быть, уже в курсе, но у вас осталось мало времени.{n}Прошу вас, оставьте наивные мысли о том, что вы сбежите, как только пройдёт буря.{n}У этой игры есть лишь один исход: либо побеждаете все вы, либо я.{n}Если ваше время истечёт, то победа будет моей. Ничьей не будет.{n}Прошу, поймите своё положение правильно.}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {e:070:― Vocês estão gostando do enigma do epitáfio do Kinzo‐sama?{n}Como todos provavelmente já sabem, vocês têm muito pouco tempo restando.{n}Por favor, abandonem qualquer esperança ingênua de escapar após a tempestade passar.{n}Este jogo só pode terminar com a minha vitória ou a de vocês.{n}Quando o tempo acabar, eu vou ganhar por desistência. Não haverá obstruções.{n}Certifiquem‐se de não entenderem mal a sua situação atual.}
Vietnamese (VI): {e:070:― Are you enjoying the riddle of Kinzo‐sama's epitaph?{n}As you are all probably aware, you have very little time remaining.{n}Please abandon any naive hopes of escaping after the storm passes.{n}This game can only end with my victory or yours.{n}When time runs out, I will win by default. There will be no ties.{n}Make sure that you do not misunderstand your current situation.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): {e:070:“不知諸位對於金藏老爺設下的碑文之謎，解讀得是否還算盡興？{n}雖然我想你們已經知曉，但還是要提醒諸位剩下的時間不多了。{n}無論如何，都請把暴風雨過後就能逃出去的天真想法丟掉。{n}我和諸位，在這盤遊戲上只有一方能獲得勝利。{n}時間用盡就算我贏了。沒有平局。{n}請千萬不要在這點上產生誤解。”}
Chinese Simplified (CN): {e:070:“不知诸位对于金藏老爷设下的碑文之谜，解读得是否还算尽兴？{n}虽然我想你们已经知晓，但还是要提醒诸位剩下的时间不多了。{n}无论如何，都请把暴风雨过后就能逃出去的天真想法丢掉。{n}我和诸位，在这盘游戏上只有一方能获得胜利。{n}时间用尽就算我赢了。没有平局。{n}请千万不要在这点上产生误解。”}
Indonesian (IDN): 'Are you enjoying the riddle of Kinzo-sama's epitaph? {n}As you are all probably aware, you have very little time remaining. {n}Please abandon any naive hopes of escaping after the storm passes. {n}This game can only end with my victory or yours. {n}When time runs out, I will win by default. There will be no ties. {n}Make sure that you do not misunderstand your current situation.'
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ‘Vi state godendo l'indovinello dell'epigrafe di Kinzo-sama? {n}Probabilmente ne siete già coscienti, ma tutti voi non avete più molto tempo. {n}Per favore, abbandonate l'ingenuo pensiero che quando la tempesta passerà, sarete capaci di fuggire via. {n}Questo gioco può finire solo con la mia o la vostra vittoria. {n}Se scadrà il tempo, vincerò io. Non ci sarà un pareggio. {n}Vi pregherei di non fraintendere la vostra attuale situazione. ’
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): {e:070:― Vi state godendo l'enigma dell'epigrafe del signor Kinzo?{n} Immagino ne siate già consapevoli, ma non è molto il tempo che vi rimane.{n} Vi prego di desistere dall'ingenua speranza di riuscire a fuggire al termine della tempesta.{n}In questo gioco, si può ottenere solo una fra due vittorie: la mia, o la vostra.{n} A tempo scaduto, la vittoria sarà mia. Non ci saranno pareggi.{n} Vi chiedo di non travisare questo passaggio.}
Turkish (TR): {e:070:― Kinzo-sama'nın kitabesinin bilmecesi sizi eğlendiriyor mu?{n}Hepinizin muhtemelen farkında olduğu gibi, çok kısıtlı bir zamanınız kaldı.{n}Fırtına geçtikten sonra kaçmak gibi safça umutlardan lütfen vazgeçin.{n}Bu oyun sadece benim ya da sizin zaferinizle sona erebilir.{n}Zaman tükendiğinde varsayılan olarak ben kazanacağım. Beraberlik olmayacak.{n}Mevcut durumunuzu yanlış değerlendirmediğinizden emin olunuz.}

PC Japanese (JP): 南條先生が必死に潔白を訴えるその姿は見ていて痛々しい。嫌疑を掛けられれば、誰もが返す正常な反応だろう。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "I declare it as Ushiromiya Natsuhi, representative of the Ushiromiya family!! There's no witch here! I won't accept {f:5:Beatrice}!! No matter what you're planning, I won't let you lay one finger on my daughter or the rest of them!!! That's my duty as a mother and as representative to the family!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "I declare it as Ushiromiya Natsuhi, representative of the Ushiromiya family!! There's no witch here! I won't accept {f:5:Beatrice}!! No matter what you're planning, I won't let you lay one finger on my daughter or the rest of them!!! That's my duty as a mother and as representative to the family!!"

No matter what you're planning, I won't let you lay one finger on my daughter or the rest of them!!! That's my duty as a mother and as representative to the family!!"

Russian (RU): "Я заявляю это как Уширомия Нацухи — представитель семьи Уширомия! Ведьмы здесь нет! Я не приму {f:5:Беатриче}!!! Чтобы вы не задумали, я не позволю вам и пальцем тронуть мою дочь и остальных!!! Таков мой долг, как матери и представителя семьи!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu declaro isso como Ushiromiya Natsuhi, representante da família Ushiromiya!! Não há nenhuma bruxa aqui! Este é meu dever como mãe e como representante da família!!"

No matter what you're planning, I won't let you lay one finger on my daughter or the rest of them!!! That's my duty as a mother and as representative to the family!!"

No matter what you're planning, I won't let you lay one finger on my daughter or the rest of them!!! That's my duty as a mother and as representative to the family!!"

Io non accetterò Beatrice!! {n}Non importa cosa tu stia pianificando, non ti permetterò di alzare un dito su mia figlia o sul resto di loro!!! Steam (ST): Genji-san and Kumasawa-san and Doctor Nanjo... All of them were on Grandfather's side. Maybe you could say that once Maria started blindly believing in {f:5:Beatrice}, she was also on Grandfather's side. ...That's right, they're all suspicious.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji-san and Kumasawa-san and Doctor Nanjo. All of them were on Grandfather's side. Maybe you could say that once Maria started blindly believing in Beatrice, she was also on Grandfather's side. ......That's right, they're all suspicious.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次さんも熊沢さんも南條先生も、祖父さま側の人間だ。真里亞だって、ベアトリーチェを妄信しているという点で祖父さま側と言えるだろう。……そうさ、全員疑わしいんだ。

Russian (RU): Генджи‐сан, Кумасава‐сан и доктор Нанджо — все они были на стороне дедушки.{n}Можно было даже сказать, что Мария, начав слепо верить в {f:5:Беатриче}, тоже переметнулась на его сторону. ......Точно, все они подозрительны.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji‐san, Kumasawa‐san e o doutor Nanjo — todos estavam do lado do vovô.{n}Você poderia até mesmo dizer que a Maria estava do lado do vovô, já que ela tinha uma crença cega na {f:5:Beatrice}. ......Isso mesmo, todos eles são suspeitos.
Vietnamese (VI): Genji‐san, Kumasawa‐san, and Doctor Nanjo—all of them were on Grandfather's side.{n}You could even say that Maria was on Grandfather's side, since she had a blind belief in {f:5:Beatrice}. ......That's right, they're all suspicious.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次、熊澤婆婆和南條大夫，都是爺爺那邊的人。{n}即使是真里亞，由於她迷信貝阿朵莉切，也可以說成是爺爺那邊的人。……沒錯，他們確實全都很可疑。

Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): Genji-san, Kumasawa-san e il dottor Nanjo, erano dalla parte del nonno.{n}Si sarebbe potuto dire che anche Maria, da quando iniziò a credere ciecamente in {f:5:Beatrice}, era dalla parte del nonno... Già, erano tutti sospetti.
Turkish (TR): Genji-san, Kumasawa-san ve Doktor Nanjo—hepsi Büyükbabamın tarafındaydı.{n}Hatta {f:5:Beatrice}'e körü körüne inandığı için Maria'nın bile Büyükbabanın tarafında olduğunu söyleyebilirsiniz. ......Doğru, hepsi şüpheli.

Steam (ST): But is this really okay...?! If we throw out all of the suspicious ones in such a lawless way, will we still have the right to defy the lawlessness of the witch...?!

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma questo è davvero giusto...?! Se buttiamo fuori tutti i sospetti così caoticamente, sarà ancora giusto per noi resistere al caos della strega...?!

Turkish (TR): Ancak çalışma odasında beklenmedik bir şekilde ortaya çıkan mektup bu safsatayı reddetmişti.{n}......Eğer zaman tükenirse, bunun cadı için zafer anlamına geleceğini çok açık bir şekilde ifade etmişti.

Steam (ST): When time runs out, is the witch planning to take on the offensive? ...This time, is she planning to display some fearful magical power, maybe something that could have been used to kill six adults at once?
Umineko Project (UP): When time runs out, is the witch planning to take on the offensive?{n}......Is she, finally, planning to display some fearful magical power, maybe something that could have been used to kill six adults at once?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When time runs out, is the witch planning to take on the offensive?......This time, is she planning to display some fearful magical power, maybe something that could have been used to kill six adults at once?
PC Japanese (JP): 時間が切れたら、魔女は打って出るつもりなのか。……今度こそ、６人の大人を一度に殺して見せたような、恐るべき魔力を振るうつもりなのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 時間が切れたら、魔女は打って出るつもりなのか。{n}……今度こそ、６人の大人を一度に殺して見せたような、恐るべき魔力を振るうつもりなのか。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando o tempo acabar, a bruxa planeja tomar a ofensiva?{n}......Ela está finalmente planejando exibir algum poder mágico terrível, talvez algo que poderia ter sido usado para matar seis adultos ao mesmo tempo?
Vietnamese (VI): When time runs out, is the witch planning to take on the offensive?{n}......Is she, finally, planning to display some fearful magical power, maybe something that could have been used to kill six adults at once?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果時間用盡了，魔女會親自出馬嗎？{n}……這次，她會使出把六位成年人一次性殺死的恐怖魔力，展示給我們看嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果时间用尽了，魔女会亲自出马吗？{n}……这次，她会使出把六位成年人一次性杀死的恐怖魔力，展示给我们看吗？
Indonesian (IDN): When time runs out, is the witch planning to take on the offensive? ...This time, is she planning to display some fearful magical power, maybe something that could have been used to kill six adults at once?
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Una volta scaduto il tempo, la strega pianificava di passare all'offensiva? ... Questa volta, pianificava di mostrarci qualche terribile potere magico, magari qualcosa che potrebbe aver usato per uccidere sei adulti in una volta?
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): A tempo scaduto, la strega sarebbe passata all'offensiva...? Stavolta intendeva manifestare un potere magico eccezionale, simile a quello con cui mostrò di aver ucciso sei adulti in un colpo solo...?
Turkish (TR): Zaman dolduğunda cadı saldırıya geçmeyi mi planlıyor?{n}......Sonunda, belki de daha öncesinde aynı anda altı yetişkini öldürmek için kullandığı korkutucu büyü gücünü göstermeyi mi planlıyor?
